application.model

Class Motivation

  • java.lang.Object
    • application.model.Motivation

  • public class Motivation
extends java.lang.Object
    Generates an array list of questions and statements intended to motivate the user to write. Contains a method which randomly selects a statement from the list and passes it back to the calling method to display on the screen.
    Author:
    Kisa Burnett.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Motivation() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods

      java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> getMotivationalQuotes()
      Gets the ArrayList of statements gathered from the file containing these statements and passes it back to the caller.

      Retrieves statements from a file and passes it into an ArrayList, which is returned back to the caller.
      java.lang.String pickQuote()
      Randomly selects a quote from the statements collected in the motivationalQuotes ArrayList and returns it to the caller.
      void setMotivationalQuotes(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> motivationalQuotes)
      Passes in an ArrayList to the class's motivationalQuotes variable.

      • getMotivationalQuotes

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> getMotivationalQuotes()
        Gets the ArrayList of statements gathered from the file containing these statements and passes it back to the caller.
        Returns:
        motivationalQuotes ArrayList which contains the motivational statements.

      • setMotivationalQuotes

        public void setMotivationalQuotes(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> motivationalQuotes)
        Passes in an ArrayList to the class's motivationalQuotes variable.
        Parameters:
        motivationalQuotes - ArrayList which contains the motivational statements.

      • loadQuotes

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> loadQuotes(java.lang.String fileName)
                                                 throws java.io.IOException
        Retrieves statements from a file and passes it into an ArrayList, which is returned back to the caller.
        Parameters:
        fileName - String with the name of the file the method should utilize.
        Returns:
        quotes ArrayList the collection of statements gathered from the file.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the file doesn't exist.

      • pickQuote

        public java.lang.String pickQuote()
        Randomly selects a quote from the statements collected in the motivationalQuotes ArrayList and returns it to the caller.
        Returns:
        pulledQuote String containing statement randomly selected from the motivationalQuotes variable.
